intro: Fagonia harpago subsp. ifniensis, commonly known as the Canary Island fagonia, is a shrub native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and rocky environments, showcasing drought-resistant features. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
